1. StretchSense Library¶

Note

Description of each functions and classes of the Raspberry Pi API.

  • Website : https://www.stretchsense.com
  • Important : This StretchSense Library has been designed to enable the connection of one or more “StretchSense Sensor” and “StretchSense IC Boards” to your Raspberry Pi
  • Author : Louis Germain
  • Copyright : 2017 StretchSense
  • Date : 26/07/2017
  • Version : 1.0.0
  • class stretchSenseLibrary.StretchSensePeripheral[source]¶

    Class which create a StretchSense peripheral with all the argument that can be used.

    Parameters:
    • addr – string: Contains the address of the device : “xx:xx:xx:xx:xx”.
    • uuid – string: Contains the UUID of the device “xxxxxxxx-7374-7265-7563-6873656e7365”.
    • value – int: Contains the value of the device in hexadecimal.
    • channelNumber – int: For devices with multiple channels, contains the number of the channel.
    • gen – int: This number is the generation of the device.
    • color – string: This gives the device a color to use when displayed.
  • class stretchSenseLibrary.StretchSenseAPI[source]¶
    • spi_generateTenChannel(self)[source]¶

      This function generate ten peripheral type StretchSensePeripheral used for the SPI.

    • spi_setup(self)[source]¶

      Start the setup of the SPI communication.

    • spi_mode(self)[source]¶

      This function is called before using the SPI transmission, it verify which mode we are using.

    • spi_triggerModeCapacitance(self)[source]¶

      When TRIGGER is enable we use this SPI function.

    • spi_continuousModeCapacitance(self)[source]¶

      When INTERRUPT is enable or in continuous mode we use this SPI function.

    • spi_writeConfiguration(self)[source]¶

      Function called in spi_setup() to write the configuration on the SPI bus.

    • spi_readCapacitance(self)[source]¶

      Function which read the capacitance in hexadecimal in the SPI bus.

      Returns:int : raw sensing from the 16FGV1.0
    • spi_getCapacitanceScalingFactor(self, resolutionConfig)[source]¶

      The 16FGV1.0 has an adjustable LSB resolution this function scales raw data to capacitance based on the configuration.

      Parameters:resolutionConfig – int : Resolution set on the SPI bus during spi_writeConfiguration.
      Returns:int : The scale of the resolution.
    • spi_extractCapacitance(self, raw, channel)[source]¶

      Does the conversion of the raw value received by the 16FGV1.0 into a decimal value.

      Parameters:
      • raw – int : Raw is the raw value that we read on the SPI bus.
      • channel – int : Number from 0 to 9 corresponding of the channel number to convert the raw value.
    • spi_listToCsv(self)[source]¶

      Display the values in a csv format in the terminal.

    • spi_getValuesCsv(self)[source]¶

      Return the values in a csv format.

      Returns:string : 16FGV1.0 values in a csv format.
    • spi_getListPeripheral(self)[source]¶

      Return a list of all peripheral created by spi_generateTenChannel().

      Returns:list : List containing all the information of each SPI peripheral connected.
    • spi_close(self)[source]¶

      Close the SPI transmission.

    • ble_printAllPeripheralsAvailable(self)[source]¶

      Display all the StretchSense’s device addresses available around.

    • ble_printAllPeripheralsConnected(self)[source]¶

      Display all the StretchSense’s device addresses connected.

    • ble_scanning(self, scanTime)[source]¶

      Scan for StretchSense devices in the area and store them in listPeripheralAvailable.

      Parameters:scanTime – int : Time to scan for.
    • ble_connectOnePeripheral(self, myDeviceAddr)[source]¶

      Connect one StretchSense device which is available using its address, generate one or more peripherals as StretchSensePeripheral and store them into listPeripheralIsConnected. The peripheral is also stored in listPeripheralInUse.

      Parameters:myDeviceAddr – string : Address of the device that you want to connect.
    • ble_connectAllPeripheral(self)[source]¶
    • ble_disconnectOnePeripheral(self, myDeviceAddr)[source]¶

      Disconnect one StretchSense device which is connected using its address, and remove it from listPeripheralIsConnected. The peripheral is also removed from listPeripheralInUse.

      Parameters:myDeviceAddr – string : Address of the device that you want to disconnect.
    • ble_disconnectAllPeripherals(self)[source]¶

      Disconnect all StretchSense devices which are connected, and remove them from both listPeripheralIsConnected and listPeripheralInUse.

    • ble_updateAllPeripherals(self)[source]¶

      Update the value of the capacitance of each StretchSense devices which are connected.

    • ble_generateOneChannel(self, peripheral)[source]¶

      When a StretchSense gen2 device is connected we create a newSensor receiving the specifications needed.

      Parameters:
      • peripheral – Peripheral : Using the BLE Peripheral format we can convert it into a StretchSensePeripheral format easier to use.
      • periphUUID – UUID : UUID of the StretchSense circuit
    • ble_generateTenChannel(self, peripheral)[source]¶

      When a StretchSense gen3 device is connected we create ten newSensor receiving the specifications needed.

      Parameters:peripheral – Peripheral : Using the BLE Peripheral format we can convert it into a StretchSensePeripheral format easier to use.
    • ble_discoverServices(self)[source]¶

      Display on the terminal all the services for each StretchSense devices connected.

    • ble_discoverCharacteristics(self)[source]¶
    • ble_updateOneChannelWithNotifications(self, data, addr)[source]¶

      Update data from one or more StretchSense gen2 devices connected using BLE notifications and stores its value.

      Parameters:
      • data – UTF-8 characters : data transmitted by the device once a notification is detected.
      • addr – string : Address of the gen2 we want to update.
    • ble_updateOneChannel(self)[source]¶

      Update once the value of every StretchSense gen2 devices connected without using BLE notifications.

    • ble_updateTenChannelWithNotifications(self, data, addr)[source]¶

      Update data from one or more StretchSense gen3 devices connected using BLE notifications and stores its value.

      Parameters:
      • data – UTF-8 characters : data transmitted by the device once a notification is detected.
      • addr – string : Address of the gen3 we want to update.
    • ble_updateTenChannel(self)[source]¶

      Update once the value of every StretchSense gen3 devices connected without BLE using notifications.

    • ble_waitNotifications(self)[source]¶

      When called, run into all connected devices waiting for notification from each of them and store the new data in their value slot.

    • ble_getListPeripheralAvailable(self)[source]¶

      Returns the list of all devices available in the area.

      Returns:[Peripheral] : List of all the devices available.
    • ble_getListAddrPeripheralAvailable(self)[source]¶

      Returns the list of all devices address available in the area.

      Returns:[addr] : List of all devices available addresses.
    • ble_getListPeripheralIsConnected(self)[source]¶

      Returns the list of all devices connected.

      Returns:[StretchSensePeripheral] : List of all devices connected.
    • ble_getListPeripheralOnceConnected(self)[source]¶

      Returns the list of all devices once connected.

      Returns:[StretchSensePeripheral] : List of all devices once connected.
    • ble_getListPeripheralInUse(self)[source]¶

      Returns the list of all devices currently in use.

      Returns:[Peripheral] : List of all devices we are using.
    • ble_listToCsv(self)[source]¶

      Displays on the terminal the values of each connected devices in a csv format.

    • ble_getValuesCsv(self)[source]¶

      Returns the values of each connected devices in a csv format.

      Returns:string : Values of each connected devices.
